Entry Hazard Wall (Grass).description:
Ferrothorn is a highly reliable wall in Grass teams, boasting good defensive stats, recovery, and an immunity to Poison. It's an incredible asset for Grass teams, as it can manage notable threats such as Kyurem, Tapu Lele, and Melmetal. Gyro Ball capitalizes on its low Speed and threatens Fairy-types and fast foes like Alolan Ninetales and Tapu Lele. However, Iron Head provides more consistent damage against slower foes like Hatterene and is less susceptible to PP stalling, which is particularly useful against Kyurem if Ferrothorn isn't running Body Press. Depending on its teammates, Ferrothorn can opt for Stealth Rock or Spikes, as Cradily can also set up Stealth Rock, while Meowscarada has access to Spikes and Toxic Spikes. With the combination of Leech Seed and Leftovers, Ferrothorn gains substantial recovery each turn, enabling it to wear down and punish switch-ins such as Heatran, Aegislash, and Nidoking. Protect serves as a scouting tool and extends the benefits of Leech Seed and Leftovers, while Body Press allows Ferrothorn to utilize its high Defense and deal significant damage to Steel- and Dark-types, like Melmetal and Weavile. When in conjunction with Gyro Ball, Body Press ensures that Substitute Kyurem won't be able to PP stall Ferrothorn, and when used with Iron Head, it guarantees an OHKO against Weavile. The featured EV spread both prevents a 2HKO from Choice Band Weavile's Icicle Crash and lets Ferrothorn almost always beat SubRoost Kyurem.

Ferrothorn forms a formidable defensive core with Mega Venusaur, as the latter's typing and ability enable it to come in on Fighting- and Ice-types such as Iron Valiant, Iron Moth, and Galarian Darmanitan. Additionally, Mega Venusaur's Sludge Bomb can poison foes, allowing Ferrothorn's combination of Leech Seed and Protect to wear them down more quickly. Cradily is another valuable partner, providing natural special bulk and a favorable matchup against Blacephalon and Nidoking. Offensive partners such as Rillaboom, Meowscarada, Iron Leaves, and Zarude greatly appreciate Ferrothorn weakening the opposing team with entry hazards and Leech Seed. In return, Rillaboom sets up Grassy Terrain for additional recovery and provides strong priority damage, while Choice Scarf Meowscarada can revenge kill threats such as boosted Kommo-o. Whimsicott and Celebi handle Fighting-types such as Iron Valiant and Kommo-o, which would otherwise pose a threat to Ferrothorn. Whimsicott also punishes setup sweepers like Volcarona or Mega Scizor, which could otherwise use Ferrothorn as setup fodder, while Celebi helps ease the Poison matchup, as well as the Steel matchup in a pinch.

Hazard Setter (Steel).description: As a check to Water- and Ground-types that can support its team with a wide variety of utility options, Ferrothorn is a notable defensive asset for Steel teams. Protect allows Ferrothorn to maximize the HP it gains per turn between Leftovers and Leech Seed, as well as easing prediction against Choice-locked foes such as Enamorus, Galarian Darmanitan, and Hisuian Arcanine. Power Whip minimizes passivity against the foes it's meant to check, notably OHKOing Mega Swampert and Gastrodon. Knock Off provides utility by removing Heavy-Duty Boots from foes such as Volcarona, Mantine, and Victini, leaving them vulnerable to the entry hazard stacking that is characteristic of Steel teams. The given EV spread with a Careful nature avoids a 2HKO from Landorus's Earth Power, with the rest invested in Defense to ease checking foes such as Mega Swampert, Ogerpon-W, and Mega Aerodactyl. The alternate EV spread with an Impish nature instead maximizes physical bulk, notably avoiding a 2HKO from Ogerpon-C's Low Kick. As Ferrothorn is easy to force out by Fire-type moves, Heatran is a solid partner to make a defensive core with it, especially because it can also set Stealth Rock, allowing Ferrothorn to run Spikes to hazard stack further; this can be further complemented with a check to Fighting-types in Gholdengo, which keeps entry hazards set by Ferrothorn on the other side of the field by blocking hazard removal. Offensive Pokemon such as Mega Scizor and Excadrill benefit from Ferrothorn wearing down and hindering the opposing team for a late-game sweep, mitigating Ferrothorn's passivity issues. Chople Berry is a niche alternative over Leftovers, as it enables Ferrothorn to withstand an attack from Fighting-types such as Keldeo and Urshifu-R, then KO back with Power Whip.

Physically Defensive (Dark).description: As a check to physical attackers with multiple utility options, Mandibuzz is a characteristic component for defensive backbones in Dark teams. Foul Play minimizes passivity, notably 2HKOing all Ogerpon formes, offensive Mega Scizor, Excadrill, and +6 Azumarill. U-turn lets Mandibuzz gain momentum by safely leaving potentially unfavorable matchups, bringing in checks that could struggle to switch in otherwise. Toxic lets Mandibuzz hinder entry hazard setters such as Ting-Lu, Araquanid, and Great Tusk, easing the use of Defog. Brave Bird hits some foes its team can otherwise struggle with, for example, OHKOing Hisuian Lilligant and 2HKOing Tapu Bulu and Buzzwole. The given EV spread allows Mandibuzz to outspeed Adamant Azumarill, with the rest invested in physical bulk to better handle foes such as Dragonite, Mega Lopunny, and Mega Scizor. Ting-Lu can switch into Electric- and Rock-types that can easily force out Mandibuzz like Tapu Koko, Zapdos, and Hisuian Arcanine. Alolan Muk can also further complement a defensive core, as it mitigates a weakness to Fairy-types such as Iron Valiant, Mega Diancie, and Mega Altaria. Offensive Pokemon such as Weavile, Meowscarada, and Hydreigon benefit from Mandibuzz's utility, mitigating its passivity issues.

Nasty Plot (Dark).description: Hydreigon is a threatening wallbreaker for Dark teams due to its high Special Attack stat, colorful coverage options, and a great ability in Levitate, which allows it to dominate Steel, Poison, Ground, and rainless Water matchups. Draco Meteor in tandem with Dragonium Z allows Hydreigon to OHKO Archaludon without a boost, outright OHKO physically defensive Ting-Lu and Alolan Muk at +2, and OHKO Hisuian Goodra at +2 after a layer of Spikes. Flamethrower threatens Steel-types like Ferrothorn, Mega Scizor, and Celesteela. Substitute provides safety against status moves from defensive Pokemon like Toxapex, Gliscor, and Ferrothorn, allowing Hydreigon to set up freely. Earth Power targets foes like Toxapex, Archaludon, Alolan Muk, and non-Air Balloon Heatran. Ting-Lu is a great partner, providing entry hazard support that makes it easier for Hydreigon to break through bulky foes, most notably allowing it to OHKO Assault Vest Iron Hands with a +2 Devastating Drake. It can also handle Volcarona with Rock Slide. Alolan Muk can handle Fairy-types like Tapu Koko, Tapu Lele, and Clefable, and, in return, Hydreigon provides a Ground immunity and threatens foes like Hippowdon. Mega Sableye provides a Fighting immunity and can cripple foes like Mega Gallade, Great Tusk, and Iron Hands with Will-O-Wisp. Additionally, Mega Sableye can use Metal Burst to get a surprise OHKO on Mega Diancie. Weavile is able to break through special walls like Blissey, Clodsire, and Alolan Muk. Choice Scarf Meowscarada revenge kills faster threats like Iron Valiant, Greninja, and Roaring Moon. In return, Hydreigon deals with physical walls like Ferrothorn, Archaludon, Skarmory, and Toxapex for them.

Offensive Quiver Dance (Bug).description: Volcarona is one of Bug's strongest setup sweepers, with a respectable Speed stat, high Special Attack, and great coverage. In addition to being one of very few special attacking options on Bug, Volcarona helps apply pressure in a variety of matchups thanks to its strong STAB moves and coverage. Fire Blast can be used over Fiery Dance for more immediate damage output. Giga Drain deals with Water- and Ground-types, most notably Swampert, Gastrodon, and Rotom-Wash. Bug Buzz can be used instead for Volcarona to overwhelm types like Dragon, Dark, and Psychic with Quiver Dance-boosted STAB attacks. Hidden Power Ground hits Heatran, allowing Volcarona to break Steel's immunity-based defensive core that can otherwise give Bug teams problems. Alternatively, Psychic can be used to damage bulky Poison-types, like Toxapex and Mega Venusaur, that can wall physical attackers like Heracross and Buzzwole. These physical attackers, in addition to Lokix and Scizor, are able to break through specially defensive walls, like Chansey and Mantine, that Volcarona struggles against. Araquanid and Armaldo provide helpful entry hazards in Sticky Web and Stealth Rock, respectively, to make sweeping mid- or late-game much easier.

Offensive Quiver Dance (Fire).description: Volcarona is one of the top setup sweepers that Fire has access to, with Quiver Dance allowing it to become a dangerous threat to teams unequipped to deal with it defensively. Psychic allows Volcarona to pressure Fighting and Poison teams, especially after one Quiver Dance, which lets Volcarona outspeed and beat Keldeo, Glimmora, and Crobat. Similarly, Giga Drain does the same to Water and Ground teams after one Quiver Dance, threatening Tapu Fini, Gastrodon, and Hippowdon. Bug Buzz covers the Psychic and Dark matchups very well and allows it to hit Roaring Moon, Ting-Lu, and Latias, which would otherwise be a challenge to deal with. Heavy-Duty Boots prevents Volcarona from being worn down by entry hazards, most notably Stealth Rock, which would otherwise stop Volcarona from being able to set up safely. Psychium Z lets Volcarona OHKO Toxapex with a +1 Shattered Psyche and beat otherwise troublesome threats like +1 Kommo-o, Iron Hands, and Clodsire. Cinderace and Mega Charizard X are especially good partners due to their ability to break through special walls such as Blissey, Clodsire, and Galarian Slowking with relative ease. Entry hazard removers such as Torkoal, Rotom-H, and Court Change Cinderace are near necessities if Volcarona is running Psychium Z. Torkoal and Rotom-H can also provide excellent utility in the form of Stealth Rock and dual screens, respectively, to help Volcarona sweep more easily. Volcanion is also an excellent partner for Volcarona that, thanks to its Water immunity, can act as a strong pivot into Pokemon like Azumarill and Mantine, which could revenge kill it or clear Quiver Dance boosts with Haze.

Utility (Fighting).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Choice Scarf (Rock).description: Terrakion is the ideal Choice Scarf user for Rock teams due to its high Speed stat and access to powerful coverage moves in Earthquake and Close Combat. Close Combat provides coverage against Steel-, Normal-, and Dark-types such as Heatran, Mega Lopunny, and Greninja. Earthquake does heavy damage against Electric-types such as Zeraora and Tapu Koko as well as against Poison-types like Toxapex and Clodsire. Poison Jab is able to pressure Grass- and Fairy-types that Rock teams struggle to deal with, being able to OHKO Tapu Bulu and Whimsicott as well as deal high amounts of damage to Azumarill and Tapu Lele. Choice Scarf allows Terrakion to be an amazing revenge killer, outspeeding threats like Mega Lopunny and Zeraora. Terrakion pairs well with Shuckle, as its Stealth Rock and Sticky Web support allows Terrakion to net more KOs and outspeed faster Pokemon like Regieleki, Choice Scarf Meowscarada, and Adamant Barraskewda under rain. Terrakion also pairs well with Mega Diancie, which softens the likes of Great Tusk, Corviknight, and Toxapex for Terrakion thanks to its coverage. Alolan Golem helps Terrakion with the Steel matchup by trapping Pokemon such as Mega Scizor, Corviknight, and Celesteela with its ability Magnet Pull. Nihilego is able to help with the Fairy matchup with Sludge Wave dealing big damage to Pokemon such as Tapu Fini and Clefable. Tyranitar helps Terrakion by setting up sand, which boosts Terrakion's Special Defense stat, allowing it to survive Surf from Choice Scarf Greninja and Dazzling Gleam from Tapu Koko. Tyranitar also provides Pursuit support against faster Choice Scarf users such as Latias while also being able to break walls for Terrakion, allowing it to clean teams more easily.

Nasty Plot Wallbreaker.description: A colorful movepool, a great Speed tier, and Regenerator make Tornadus-T one of Flying's best wallbreakers. Bleakwind Storm can be used if Tornadus-T is paired with Mega Charizard Y, as its accuracy is not affected by sun. Focus Blast grants Tornadus-T excellent neutral coverage and is able to hit most Steel- and Rock-types, like Heatran and Tyranitar, hard. Heat Wave, however, has the benefit of nailing Jirachi, Gholdengo, and Corviknight, which makes it a better option against Psychic, Ghost, and, if using Knock Off, Steel teams. In the last slot, Taunt is preferred, so Tornadus-T can safely set up on walls like Toxapex and Ting-Lu, but Knock Off's ability to cripple the likes of defensive Heatran and Galarian Slowking is worth considering. Tornadus-T has a very poor matchup against Electric-types, so Pokemon that can deal with them, such as Landorus-T and Gliscor, are must-haves. They're also able to lay down Stealth Rock and have access to Defog, making them incredible teammates. Similarly, Corviknight and Celesteela stomach most Ice-type attacks aimed at Tornadus-T, thanks to their bulk and Steel typing. Mega Charizard Y forms a terrifying wallbreaking duo alongside Tornadus-T that breaks down shared checks such as Heatran and Blissey. Setup sweepers like Dragon Dance Dragonite and Agility Thundurus-T greatly appreciate Tornadus-T weakening or removing walls for them. 88 HP and 8 Special Defense EVs can be used over Special Attack to ensure Tornadus-T lives an Ice Beam from Choice Scarf Greninja from full health.

Electrium Z (Flying).description: Thundurus-T makes for a great setup sweeper on Flying teams thanks to its access to Agility, high Special Attack, and great coverage. Hidden Power Ice forms a great BoltBeam combination with Thunderbolt, threatening Ground-types such as the Landorus formes, Gliscor, and Garchomp, with the removal of the former two allowing it to sweep Flying teams late-game. Grass Knot handles certain Ground-types better than Hidden Power Ice such as Great Tusk, Gastrodon, and physically defensive Ting-Lu. Agility allows Thundurus-T to outspeed and threaten normally faster foes such as Iron Valiant, Enamorus, and rain-boosted Mega Swampert. Gigavolt Havoc allows Thundurus-T to immediately remove bulky threats such as Rotom-W, Hatterene, and Mega Gallade as well as hindrances to its sweep like specially defensive Celesteela, Toxapex, and Ogerpon-W. Gliscor and Landorus make for great partners, as they alleviate pressure from Thundurus-T, cover the Electric matchup, and set up entry hazards. Additionally, Gliscor provides pivoting via U-turn and removes items such as Heavy-Duty Boots from Dragonite and Zapdos, while Landorus's coverage allows it to cover threats such as Mega Charizard X, Tyranitar, and Tapu Bulu. Entry hazard removal from Corviknight and Mantine is appreciated by Thundurus-T due to its vulnerability to Stealth Rock. Additionally, Corviknight and Celesteela handle Fairy- and Rock-types like Tapu Bulu, Mega Diancie, and Iron Boulder. Early-game wallbreakers such as Tornadus-T and Mega Charizard Y remove walls that Thundurus-T struggles with such as Mega Venusaur and Ferrothorn. In return, they appreciate Thundurus-T's Electric immunity. Choice Scarf Enamorus provides great speed control, with it potentially being able to sweep through Dragon and Dark teams that lack a proper answer; it also provides Healing Wish support to potentially re-enable a sweep from Thundurus-T. In return, it handles Steel-types for Thundurus-T like Corviknight and Mega Scizor. Thundurus-T's ability to threaten walls such as Toxapex, Great Tusk, and Ting-Lu can also enable other sweepers like Dragonite, Mega Aerodactyl, and Galarian Moltres to start a sweep of their own.

Gravity (Ground).description: Due to its potent ability, admirable offensive stats, and great coverage, Landorus cements itself as a staple wallbreaker on Ground teams. Sludge Wave hits Grass-types like Tapu Bulu and Celebi as well as other Fairy-types such as Tapu Lele and Clefable, easing the Fairy and Grass matchups due to unresisted coverage. Focus Blast breaks through Kyurem, Ting-Lu, and Ferrothorn. Rock Polish enables Landorus as a late-game cleaner, shutting down revenge killing abilities from faster foes like Tapu Koko, Choice Scarf Galarian Darmanitan, and Greninja, while Nasty Plot allows Landorus to easily break past the likes of Blissey and Mega Sableye and become terrifying with Gravity-aided Earth Power spam. Rock Slide is another option to hit Volcarona, as it is dangerous once set up, as well as Mantine, Zapdos, and Araquanid; however, using it is very situational and forces Landorus to use an unpreferred nature. Gravity allows Landorus to ease the Flying and Steel matchups and easily spam Earth Power, increasing its potential to new heights and also supporting its teammates like Choice Band Sand Rush Excadrill. Gastrodon is a great teammate due to its ability to soak up Water-type moves from foes like Barraskewda and Mega Swampert, while Gastrodon appreciates Landorus's ability to threaten Grass-types with Sludge Wave. Mamoswine is heavily valued as a sponge for Ice-type moves due to its ability Thick Fat, taking on SubRoost Kyurem and Alolan Ninetales. In return, Mamoswine cleans up Flying teams once Landorus deals with Celesteela, Corviknight, or Skarmory. Choice Scarf or Bulk Up Great Tusk forms a great wallbreaking core, taking out threats like Triple Axel Mega Lopunny and Dragonite, while also appreciating Gravity support. Clodsire provides entry hazards to chip down walls for Landorus, switches into revenge killers like Meowscarada and Tapu Koko, and counters Volcarona with Unaware so Landorus doesn't need to use Rock Slide. Mega Steelix is valued in the Ice and Fairy matchups, taking on Alolan Ninetales, Tapu Koko, Azumarill, and Weavile. Mega Garchomp and Garchomp threaten specially defensive walls like Slowking, Blissey, and Mantine while also providing a Water neutrality with decent defensive stats.

Wallbreaker (Flying).description: By virtue of its STAB moves, coverage options, and helpful ability in Sheer Force, Landorus makes for a great wallbreaker, matching up well against Dragon, Electric, and Psychic teams and handling the likes of Raging Bolt and Kyurem. Focus Blast targets Dark- and Ice-types like Hydreigon, Piloswine, and Kyurem and can 2HKO switch-ins like Rotom-W, Skarmory, and Ferrothorn. Alternatively, Rock Slide in tandem with a neutral nature and 4 Attack EVs can be used to target Flying- and Bug-types such as Mega Charizard Y, Zapdos, and Volcarona; it also breaks Gholdengo's Air Balloon and hits Ice-types more accurately than Focus Blast. Sludge Wave takes on Grass- and Fairy-types such as Tapu Bulu and Celebi. Stealth Rock wears down incoming foes so that Landorus and its teammates can wallbreak and sweep more efficiently, and it breaks Sturdy from Ogerpon-C. Alternatively, Rock Polish allows Landorus to serve as a cleaner as well by outspeeding and threatening Choice Scarf Weavile, Greninja, and Meowscarada. Tornadus-T makes for a great teammate, taking on problematic Grass- and Fighting-types such as Ogerpon-C, Hisuian Lilligant, and Mega Gallade. Corviknight and Mantine both remove Stealth Rock with Defog so Landorus has an easier time switching in. Corviknight also threatens Ice-types such as Weavile and Alolan Ninetales and provides slow pivoting with U-turn, while Mantine fares well against Water-types like Barraskewda and Mega Swampert. Mega Aerodactyl not only threatens Ice-types, but its coverage also allows it to threaten opposing Landorus, Garchomp, and Tornadus-T; it can also run Stealth Rock so Landorus can run Rock Polish instead. Landorus's wallbreaking opens up sweeping opportunities for Galarian Moltres and Dragonite, which appreciate the removal of their checks such as Alolan Muk and Iron Hands.

Choice Scarf (Flying).description: Choice Scarf Landorus-T is one of the best revenge killers Flying teams have access to, outrunning threats like Tapu Koko, Mega Diancie, and Terrakion while boasting great firepower. It's also very desirable thanks to its defensive traits, which include an immunity to Electric-type attacks and Intimidate. U-turn takes advantage of the switches Landorus-T forces, allowing it to pivot out of walls that come in on it such as Corviknight and Mega Venusaur. Similarly, Knock Off cripples some of the bulky Pokemon it invites in, like Porygon2 and Ferrothorn, by removing their items. Stone Edge notably hits Kyurem the hardest and is Landorus-T's best move versus Flying-types like Zapdos and Pelipper. Alternatively, Explosion lets Landorus-T score a surprise KO against an offensive threat it normally cannot OHKO, such as Keldeo or Mega Lopunny. Special wallbreakers like Galarian Moltres, Tornadus-T, and Mega Charizard Y are great partners to deal with the aforementioned physical walls Landorus-T draws in. Thundurus-T relieves pressure from Landorus-T by acting as a secondary Electric immunity and is a great asset against the Water and Flying teams Landorus-T can't do much to. Mega Aerodactyl is able to form a powerful revenge killing core alongside Landorus-T while providing Stealth Rock support for it to clean teams more easily. Corviknight switches into most Ice-type attacks aimed at Landorus-T, removes Stealth Rock with Defog, and is able to bring Landorus-T safely onto the field via its slow U-turn.

Bulk Up (Ground).description:
Ferrothorn's Power Whip does not break Substitute at +1 Def or -1 Atk from Intimidate.

This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Choice Specs (Dragon).description: Choice Specs Kyurem is a terrifying wallbreaker with an impeccable STAB combination and coverage movepool, beating threats to Dragon teams like Toxapex, Dragonite, and Mamoswine. Draco Meteor is Kyurem's most powerful move, notably wearing down typical switch-ins like Mega Sableye and Volcarona. Freeze-Dry is highly effective in the Water matchup by answering would-be checks like Swampert, Gastrodon, and Slowking. Focus Blast catches Ferrothorn and Tyranitar off guard should they expect a STAB move, while Earth Power hits Alolan Muk, Galarian Slowking, and Heatran for more damage. Mega Altaria is heavily appreciated as an answer to Dragon-types like Kommo-o, Roaring Moon, and Walking Wake. Garchomp provides entry hazards like Stealth Rock and Spikes to ease Kyurem's wallbreaking. Latias checks Fighting-types such as Iron Hands, Galarian Zapdos, and Terrakion, is able to replenish Kyurem's health with Healing Wish, and removes troublesome entry hazards—especially Stealth Rock, given Kyurem's Rock weakness—with Defog. Dragalge sets up Toxic Spikes and checks Fairy-types like Tapu Koko and Clefable. Kommo-o checks Steel-types like Heatran and defensive Celesteela and blocks attempts to set hazards with Taunt.

Substitute + Roost (Ice).description: Kyurem is a stellar stallbreaker for Ice teams by utilizing Pressure, Substitute, and Roost to beat or force out walls such as Toxapex, Ferrothorn, and Mega Sableye. Kyurem's good bulk and typing also allow it to function as a defensive pivot, consistently checking threats like Heatran, Rotom-W, and Rillaboom. Moreover, it shrugs a hit from and beats the likes of Galarian Zapdos and Urshifu-R one-on-one if using a Chople Berry. Freeze-Dry lands a strong hit on Water-types like Toxapex and Gastrodon, turning Kyurem into a valuable asset in that matchup. Alongside it, Earth Power grants Kyurem near-perfect neutral coverage by nailing Steel- and Fire-types such as Magnezone and Skeledirge. The given EV spread allows Kyurem's Substitute to live one Seismic Toss from Blissey. Alolan Ninetales provides Snow and Aurora Veil support, bolstering Kyurem's defensive utility while preventing Celesteela and Heatran from breaking its Substitute. Defensive Cloyster is able to remove entry hazards with Rapid Spin, set up Spikes to help Kyurem stallbreak more easily, and switch into physical Steel-type attacks from Mega Scizor and Melmetal. Similarly, Piloswine lays down Stealth Rock and deals with Fire- and Rock-types that Kyurem loses to, such as Volcarona and Mega Diancie. Setup sweepers like Swords Dance Weavile and Shell Smash Cloyster greatly appreciate Kyurem wearing down walls so they can clean up late-game.

Choice Specs (Fighting).description: Keldeo stands out as Fighting team's premier Choice Specs user, leveraging its solid typing and unique toolkit to easily break past physical walls such as Mega Sableye and Gliscor that often cause issues for Fighting teams. Hydro Pump is Keldeo's strongest attack, washing away Ground- and Fire-types like the Landorus formes, Great Tusk, and Skeledirge with ease. Secret Sword enables Keldeo to break special walls such as Blissey and Hisuian Goodra that would otherwise wall it. Vacuum Wave serves as a Fighting team's main form of priority, being used to pick off weakened targets such as Sand Rush Excadrill and Meowscarada, which can be a nuisance to Fighting teams. Finally, Keldeo can use Icy Wind to immediately remove threats such as Garchomp and Latios in a pinch. Alternatively, Scald can be used as a completely accurate Water-type STAB move in situations where Hydro Pump's higher power isn't needed, while Hidden Power Electric enables Keldeo to break past Pelipper and Mantine. Iron Hands serves as an excellent partner to Keldeo, as it is able to break through Water-types that can handle Keldeo such as Tapu Fini and Toxapex along with taking on faster Flying-types like Tornadus-T and Mega Pidgeot; in return, it appreciates Keldeo breaking Ground-types such as Gliscor and Great Tusk. Mega Gallade can break through problematic threats that can easily take on Keldeo such as Mega Venusaur and Water Absorb Clodsire, which otherwise wall Keldeo. Iron Valiant deals with Dragon-type threats such as Kommo-o, Mega Altaria, and Latias along with using coverage moves like Shadow Ball to beat Sinistcha. Breloom and Hisuian Lilligant both assist Keldeo by breaking down Water-types like Swampert and Greninja and appreciate Keldeo handling Fire-types like Torkoal and Ceruledge. Great Tusk provides Rapid Spin and Stealth Rock support, enabling Keldeo to get in safely while chipping down switch-ins like Assault Vest Iron Hands, and its Ground typing enables it to handle Electric-types such as Regieleki and Raging Bolt. Sneasler is a fast teammate that can handle Fairy- and Grass-types like Iron Valiant, Tapu Bulu, and Breloom.

Calm Mind (Water).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Choice Specs (Water).description: With its exceptional movepool and Protean to further bolster its power, Choice Specs Greninja makes for an incredible wallbreaker for Water teams, eliminating threats like Tapu Bulu, Sinistcha, and Mega Latias for the teams. Dark Pulse targets Ghost- and Psychic-types like Gholdengo and Latios. Sludge Wave provides crucial coverage, threatening Fairy- and Grass-types like Iron Valiant, Tapu Bulu, and Ogerpon-W. In addition to targeting Grass-types, Ice Beam also targets Dragon- and Flying-types like Dragonite and Zapdos. Extrasensory deals with Poison- and Fighting-types like Mega Venusaur, Toxapex, and non-Choice Scarf Urshifu-R and 2HKOes Assault Vest Iron Hands. When boosted by rain, Hydro Pump provides Greninja with an incredible nuke, allowing it to OHKO threats like Mega Gallade and Mega Scizor and 2HKO Celesteela and non-Assault Vest Alolan Muk. Alternatively, Switcheroo can also be used in the last moveslot, allowing Greninja to punish would-be switch-ins like Ferrothorn and Hisuian Goodra. Physical attackers like Mega Swampert, Choice Band Barraskewda, Urshifu-R, and Ogerpon-W can eliminate special walls like Hisuian Goodra and Alolan Muk. With their secondary Ground typing, Swampert and Mega Swampert can handle Electric-types like Iron Hands and Raging Bolt and provide Stealth Rock support and safe entry to Greninja with Flip Turn. Mega Swampert and Barraskewda also provide valuable speed control, threatening foes like Mega Lopunny, Tapu Koko, and Choice Scarf users like Enamorus, with Barraskewda even outspeeding Choice Scarf variants of Meowscarada and Sneasler. Greninja appreciates Fighting-type coverage from teammates like Urshifu-R, Ogerpon-W, and Barraskewda to break through foes like Ferrothorn and Kyurem. Ogerpon-W can also remove bulky Water-types like Swampert and Gastrodon. Pelipper boosts the power of Greninja's Hydro Pump with its rain, can also provide a safe entry to Greninja with U-turn, and removes entry hazards with Defog. Toxapex offers an important neutrality to Grass and a resistance to Fighting, which allows it to take on foes like Meowscarada and Iron Valiant. Additionally, Toxapex provides valuable team support by setting up Toxic Spikes. Empoleon helps stave off threats like Kyurem and Tapu Lele, provides Stealth Rock support and safe entry to Greninja with its slow Flip Turn, and serves as a Defogger.

Choice Specs (Dark).description: Choice Specs Greninja is one of Dark's best wallbreakers thanks to its amazing Speed and coverage, which is further boosted by Protean. Hydro Pump targets Fire-, Rock-, and Ground-types like Torkoal, Heatran, Mega Diancie, and Hippowdon. Sludge Wave threatens Grass- and Fairy-types such as Tapu Bulu, Mega Altaria, and non-Choice Scarf Iron Valiant. Alternatively, Dark Pulse nails Ghost- and Psychic-types such as Gholdengo, Hisuian Zoroark, and Slowbro, while Switcheroo lets Greninja weaken special walls that it cannot threaten otherwise like Alolan Muk, Hisuian Goodra, and Blissey. Sludge Wave is the preferred option out of the three, however, due to nailing threats that many of Greninja's teammates struggle with like Ogerpon-W and non-Choice Scarf Tapu Lele. Ice Beam allows Greninja to handle Dragon- and Flying-types like Garchomp, Mega Latias, and the Landorus formes. Extrasensory targets Poison- and Fighting-types like Toxapex, Mega Venusaur, Okidogi, and Keldeo. Choice Scarf Meowscarada provides speed control and forms a Protean core with Greninja, with it outspeeding and taking on Swampert, Choice Scarf Roaring Moon, and Choice Scarf Iron Valiant. Ting-Lu sets up entry hazards to aid Greninja's wallbreaking, giving Greninja a good chance to OHKO Latias after Stealth Rock damage, and it also handles Steel-types such as Excadrill, Gholdengo, and Iron Crown. Furthermore, it provides an Electric immunity, which allows it to take on Electric-types like Tapu Koko, terrain-boosted Alolan Raichu, and Zeraora. Choice Scarf Hydreigon, Mandibuzz, and Galarian Moltres aid Greninja in the Ground matchup due to their immunities. Hydreigon also deals with Choice Scarf Gholdengo and Choice Scarf Kleavor with its STAB moves; Mandibuzz removes entry hazards with Defog and pivots Greninja in with U-turn; and Galarian Moltres can sweep late-game with Agility and Nasty Plot after Greninja wallbreaks. Alolan Muk's great special bulk helps Greninja deal with Fairy-types like Tapu Koko, Tapu Lele, and Enamorus. In return, Alolan Muk appreciates Greninja taking on Ground-types like Great Tusk and Garchomp. Greninja's wallbreaking opens the door for sweeping and cleaning opportunities from the likes of Galarian Moltres and Weavile.
